DOC.brief_summary: This is an intervention study which evaluates the cardiovascular primary preventive effects of using stairs instead of elevators at the worksite during a 12-weeks period. We hypothesize that stair-climbing during working hours can meet the daily amount of physical activity recommended by current public health guidelines.
DOC.brief_title: Stair Instead of Elevator Use at Work: Cardiovascular Primary Preventive Effects on Hospital Employees.
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 years No or little stairuse at work (< 5 stories/day) Sedentary lifestyle Positive answers to the health screening physical activity readiness questionnaire (PARQ) Parttime employment < 80% Absence of more than 2 weeks during the intervention period Intention to begin a weight control program Medication changes which may influence blood pressure, lipid or glucose metabolism
